title: English Articles — Morning Routine
text: I made ___ cup of coffee and read ___ newspaper before going to ___ office.

blanks.explanation: 'The' refers to a specific, known newspaper.
'The' refers to the speaker's specific office.

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris has been the capital of France since the 10th century.

questions.question: What is the capital of Japan?
questions.explanation: Tokyo has been the capital since 1868.

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra was purpose-built as the capital as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.statement: The Sun revolves around the Earth.
questions.explanation: The Earth revolves around the Sun.

questions.statement: Water boils at 100°C at standard atmospheric pressure.
questions.explanation: At 1 atm, water's boiling point is exactly 100°C.

questions.statement: Sound travels faster in water than in air.
questions.explanation: Sound travels about 4x faster in water (~1,480 m/s) than in air (~343 m/s).

title: English Articles — At the Zoo
text: ___ elephant was eating ___ banana near ___ tree.

questions.question: Which number is prime?
questions.explanation: 29 is only divisible by 1 and itself.

questions.question: What is the square root of 144?
Which word is closest in meaning to 'benevolent'?
Which word is closest in meaning to 'ephemeral'?
questions.explanation: 'Ephemeral' means lasting for a very short time.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'ubiquitous'?
questions.explanation: 'Ubiquitous' means present, appearing, or found everywhere.

questions.statement: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye.
questions.explanation: This is a common myth. The wall is too narrow to be seen from space without aid.

questions.statement: The ancient Romans used concrete in their buildings.
questions.explanation: Roman concrete (opus caementicium) was used extensively, including in the Pantheon.

questions.statement: Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the building of the Great Pyramid.
questions.explanation: The Great Pyramid was built ~2560 BC, Cleopatra lived ~30 BC, and the Moon landing was 1969 AD.

title: English Articles — Weekend Hike
text: Last Saturday, Alex decided to climb ___ mountain near the town. He packed ___ backpack with food and started early in ___ morning. After a few hours, he reached ___ top and enjoyed ___ breathtaking view.

blanks.explanation: 'A' introduces a nonspecific mountain mentioned for the first time.
'The' identifies the specific top of that mountain.
'A' introduces the view as one example among many.

questions.question: Which is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile is approximately 6,650 km long.

questions.question: Which continent has the most countries?
What is the smallest country in the world by area?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is only about 0.44 km².
